qns.classic package¶

Submodules¶

qns.classic.event module¶

class qns.classic.event.ClassicReceiveEvent(to, msg, source=None, init_time: Optional[float] = None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.event.Event

The event that calls the receiver to receive the classic message

Parameters

  • to -- the receiver node

  • msg -- the classic message

run(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

It is the real event's handle functions. run should be overrided.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator.

qns.classic.link module¶

class qns.classic.link.ClassicLink(nodes=[], name=None)¶

Bases: qns.topo.basic.Channel

This is a classic link that can be used to transfer classic message

Parameters

  • nodes -- a node list. Those nodes are connected on this link.

  • name (str) -- the link's name

class qns.classic.link.ClassicLinkProtocol(entity, delay=0, possible=1, rate=None, precision=1)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

The protocol for classic link. It will transfer classic message from one side to another.

Parameters

  • entity -- a classic or quantum node

  • delay -- the delay time to transfer a message in second

  • rate -- the bandwidth of this channel.

  • precision -- cycle time of bandwidth check. If precision is larger, the bandwidth checking will be rough.

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event=None)¶

Receive the message and then transfer it to another side

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg -- the classic message

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

qns.classic.message module¶

class qns.classic.message.Message(content, from_node, to_node, link=None)¶

Bases: object

This class presents a classic message.

If the content is a string or a list, its length will be used to present the package size. Otherwise, the package size will be set to 1.

Parameters

  • content -- the real message content

  • from_node -- the message sender

  • to_node -- the message recevier

  • link -- the first link which the from_node will put this message into

qns.classic.node module¶

class qns.classic.node.ClassicNode(name=None)¶

Bases: qns.topo.basic.Node

This is a Classic Node class

Parameters

  • name (str) -- the name of this network node.

  • classic_links -- attached classic link (ClassicLink)

class qns.classic.node.ClassicRecvProtocol(entity)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

This is a Protocol that enables a classic node or a quantum node to receive a classic message. Then, the entity will print this message.

This Protocol can be overrided to implement other functions.

Parameters

entity (qns.topo.basic.Node) -- the entity that will inject this protocol

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: object, source=None, event=None)¶

When this handle function is called, the entity will print the received msg.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg (Message) -- The classic message to be sent

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

class qns.classic.node.ClassicSendProtocol(entity)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

This is a Protocol that enables a classic node or a quantum node to send a classic Message

Parameters

entity (qns.topo.basic.Node) -- the entity that will inject this protocol

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: qns.classic.message.Message, source=None, event=None)¶

When this handle function is called, the msg will be send on the link msg.link.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg (Message) -- The classic message to be sent

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

class qns.classic.node.ClassicSwitchProtocol(entity, forwarding={}, delay=0, buffer_size=None)¶

Bases: qns.schedular.protocol.Protocol

This protocol enables a node to be a classic switcher. When the node receive a message, it will look up the forwarding table and decide which link will be used to forward this message. The forwarding table has the following format:

{outnode1: outlink1, outnode2: outlink2 ...}

Parameters

  • entity (qns.topo.basic.Node) -- the entity that will inject this protocol

  • forwarding -- a dict that indicates the target node and its next hop link.

  • delay -- the delay time of handling each message in second.

handle(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator, msg: qns.classic.message.Message, source=None, event=None)¶

When this handle function is called, the msg will be forwarded by the forwarding table.

Parameters

  • simulator -- the simulator

  • msg (Message) -- The classic message to be sent

  • source -- the entity that generated the event

  • event -- the event

install(simulator: qns.schedular.simulator.Simulator)¶

install will be called before the simulator starts. It can be used to initialize or insert initial events.

Parameters

simulator -- the simulator

Module contents¶

The classic network model for sending and receiving classic message.
